xml.episodeInfo:
FUTURAMA
Episode 211
THE LESSER OF TWO EVILS
Eric Horstead Dave, The Neutral Planet
xml.info: Advertisment: Fry, Bender and Leela are heroes in an oval.
xml.speak: (voice-over) Futurama is brought to you by......Arachno Spores! The fatal spore, with the funny name!
xml.info: Opening Credits. Caption: The Show That Watches Back.
Planet Express: Lounge. A show called Cop Department is on TV.
Fry, Bender and Leela sit slumped on the couch. The coffee table is filled with dishes, uneaten burgers and boxes of Chinese food. On the TV is a dazed centipede-like alien with a blurred face.
xml.speak: ON TV C'mon man, I didn't fire off no laser.
ON TV Then why is there a smoking hole in your ceiling sir?
xml.info: The camera points to the ceiling.
xml.speak: ON TV What? Crazy upstairs lady must've been shooting down.
ON TV Sir, you're on the top floor of this particular domicile.
xml.info: The alien's wife walks in.
xml.speak: 'S WIFE ON TV You get that camera out of my house!
ON TV Just relax ma'am. Sir, sir, put down the lamp.
xml.info: The alien smashes the lamp.
xml.speak: ON TV OK. OK, I'm co-operating.
ON TV That's it, now put up your hands.
xml.info: The alien puts it's 20 hands in the air and URL moves towards him, cuffs at the ready.
xml.speak: ON TV Nice and slow. Aww yeah!
ON TV And while you're at it, unblur your face.
ON TV Aw man.
xml.info: He unblurs his face. It wasn't a TV effect!
xml.speak: Hey Bender, I thought you said you were in this episode.
Nah, this week I'm on Caught On Tape 3 because of what I did in the coffee pot.
xml.info: Fry spits out his coffee. On the TV URL walks the alien out of the building.
xml.speak: ON TV I'm sorry, I'm really sorry. I'm just going through some things.
xml.info: Smitty opens the car door but the alien head butts him and runs into some bushes. URL lifts up a shoe.
xml.speak: ON TV I'm goin' in.
xml.info: The Cop Department logo appears on the screen.
The picture changes to a traffic-packed New New York.
xml.speak: (tense and impatient) Shut up and get to the point!
xml.info: A woman looks around the street.
xml.speak: ON TV It's like stepping back stepping back into the year 2000!
xml.info: A cowboy riding a hover-moped and carrying a harpoon pulls up. More cowboys follow him.
xml.speak: ON TV Time for the mammoth hunt dudes!
xml.info: They ride off and start attacking a robotic mammoth on the streets. It roars. A hot air balloon flies over head. Inside are actors playing Albert Einstein and Hammurabi, an ancient king of Babylonia who reigned around 2000BC, rather than AD.
xml.speak: Let's disco dance Hammurabi!
Dy-no-mite!
xml.info: And they do. The Past-O-Rama logo appears on the screen, a play on the title logo of an unpopular cartoon series from the early 21st century.
xml.speak: Sounds like your kinda place Fry. Wanna go?
Nah. If I ever wanna go back to the year 2000 I'll just freeze myself again.
C'mon Fry, I really wanna see it. You know how I yearn for a simpler time. A time of barn dances and buggy rides, before life was cheapened by heartless hi-tech machines.
But Bender you are -
xml.info: Bender hods his hands to his ear units and shakes his head.
xml.speak: Blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah...
xml.info: Outside Past-O-Rama. The place has a Disneyland-esque theme to it and a slogan adorns a sign: "It's Da Boom!"

Cut to: Past-O-Rama Street. Bender, Leela and Fry walk around the streets, crowded with other tourists. They pass shops such as 47th Street Butter Churns, Iowa Bagel Co and a cinema playing Star Wars 9: Yoda's Bar Mitzvah.
xml.speak: Cool, it's just like the good old days!
xml.info: A man jumps Fry with a knife.
xml.speak: Give me your wallet or I'll cut you!
xml.info: Fry laughs.
xml.speak: Hey Leela, get a picture of me being "mugged."
xml.info: He dangles his wallet in front of the mugger and Leela takes a photo.
xml.speak: I'll take the camera too.
xml.info: He takes it and runs out through an exit. Fry laughs until he realises what has happened. He clears his throat.
xml.speak: Learning is fun.
xml.info: Time Lapse. Leela points at a screen with Dow: 11,107 on it.
xml.speak: Ooo, ancient Wall Street.
xml.info: The Dow drops to 7,539 and stockbrokers crowd around the windows inside.
xml.speak: No!
I'm ruined!
xml.info: They throw themselves out of the window. The Dow goes back up to 11,108 and they fly back through the windows with jet-packs.
Time Lapse. The trio have joined a tour group. The guide is dressed in old fashioned very pre-20th century American clothing.
xml.speak: I direct your attention to this ancient and mysterious tablet which has yet to be deciphered.
xml.info: He points to a parking sign. Leela turns to Fry.
xml.speak: Do you know what it means?
Yeah I asked a cop once. It means "Up yours kid."
xml.info: Bender puts his arms around Fry and Leela.
xml.speak: I gotta say I'm really enjoying the day out with you people - Hey, a suicide booth! So long suckers.
Uh, sorry Bender that's just a phone booth.
(disappointed) Oh.
What were they used for?
In New York? Bathrooms.
Oh. I-I'll be out in a sec.
xml.info: She walks into the phonebox.

Past-O-Rama XLIInd Street Subway. A guy with an afro stands next to some graffiti on the wall that just says "graffiti." On the same wall are two signs, one advertising "Learn Spanglish" and the other advertising "Laser Tentacle Surgery" in AL1. Bender, Fry and Leela stand by a turnstile.
xml.speak: (reading) Tokens only. (talking) How does this work?
I'll show you. Whup.
Ohh, it's a turnstile.
xml.info: He hops over it and Leela follows with some fancy vaulting.
Past-O-Rama Subway Train. Leela, Bender and Fry look around the messy train car.
xml.speak: What's this? Another bathroom?
No, it's a mobile apartment with no rent.
xml.info: He lies down on a seat and puts a newspaper over him. Bender hits him.
xml.speak: C'mon Fry get up!
xml.info: Fry snarls like a grumpy homeless person and turns away from him.
Past-O-Rama Street. They walk out of the subway and head elsewhere.
Past-O-Rama Tresures Of The Holy Tomb. The 20th century museum seems to be themed on Ancient Egypt. Leela reads a tour leaflet.
xml.speak: Wow! The burial chamber of the 20th century's greatest spiritual leader - Al Sharpton.
xml.info: Bender looks at a glass case of jewellery.
xml.speak: Wow. Now this guy had taste!
It says he was mummified in ceremonial vestments.
We sometimes called it a jogging suit.
xml.info: Past-O-Rama Traffic Pavilion. Fry, Leela and Bender watch a holo-film of a busy New York street, packed with cars.
xml.speak: (voice-over) They traffic jams of Old New York were a public forum of free interchange of opinions.
xml.info: In the holo-film the cars honk their horns.
xml.speak: (voice-over) It all started with Gerald Ford's famous invention, the "automocar" ......which was powered by a tank of burning fossils. Here we see a 20th century assembly line where cars were constructed by primative robots.
xml.info: A metal door goes up and behind it robots dressed like cavemen bang car frames with clubs.
xml.speak: (chanting) Ooga ooga ooga ooga ooga ooga...
We've come a long way baby!
xml.info: The walkway moves on.
xml.speak: (voice-over) The fruit of the robots' labour was this......the stately 1992 Latoura.
Hey, my girlfriend had one of those! Actually it wasn't her's it was her dad's. Actually she wasn't my girlfriend. She just lived next door and never closed her curtains.
Fry, remember when I told you about always ending your stories a sentence earlier?
C'mon, let's sneak in for a closer look.
xml.info: He peers in through the car's window. A man dressed in medieval clothes stands behind him.
xml.speak: Sir, we don't touch the antiques sir. You - oh! I'm sorry. You work here. I should have realised from that ridiculous getup you're wearing.
Hey! This is from Miller's Outpo - uh, I mean, yeah, I work here alright!
xml.info: The man hands him some keys.
xml.speak: Here, move this rust bucket outside behind Saint Koch's cathedral.
xml.info: He moves away but takes one last look at Fry and laughs.
Cut to: Car. Fry and Bender climb in the front and Leela sits in the back.
xml.speak: Did you drive much in the 20th century Fry?
Nope. No one in New York drove. There was too much traffic. Nice! Listen to that baby purr!
There's a baby in there huh?
xml.info: Fry looks in behind him, in the rear-view mirror and behind him again.
xml.speak: It's just like riding a bicyc -
xml.info: Cut to: Past-O-Rama Traffic Pavilion. The car lurches forward and smashes through the wall.

Cut to: Past-O-Rama Street. The three scream as the car speeds past people and cuts up a taxi being pulled a rickshaw driver, with a couple sat on the roof. The car mounts the pavement and they carry on screaming.

Cut to: Past-O-Rama Theatre. 26 dancebots can-can to a packed theatre hall. The car ploughs through the wall and drives across the stage, cutting off the dancebots' legs. The dancebots fall to the floor.
Cut to: Past-O-Rama Street. The car spins out of control past a three-card-montï¿½-bot and finnaly crashes into something and comes to a stop.
Cut to: Car. The airbags inflate in the front and the three groan.
xml.speak: I think I got whiplash.
You can't have whiplash, you don't have a neck.
I meant ass whiplash.
I'm just glad we hit something. I thought we'd never stop.
xml.info: He opens the door and gets out.

Cut to: Past-O-Rama Street. Bender and Leela get out too. There is a huge smoking dent in the front of the car. The trio gasp. The thing that made the dent was another bending unit. It is Bender's exact double, except for a goatee. The bending unit rubs it's ass.
xml.speak: Ow! I think I got whiplash.
xml.info: He falls unconcious.

Planet Express: Lounge. Fry, Zoidberg, Leela and Hermes impatiently pace around the room while Bender casually sits on the couch reading a magazine. Fry looks at a clock. 6:24. 6:25. Enter Farnsworth and Amy, wearing masks and work aprons. Farnsworth holds a blowtorch.
xml.speak: How's that robot I ran over?
xml.info: Farnsworth lifts his mask.
xml.speak: We did all we could.
xml.info: Fry gasps.
xml.speak: You mean he's -
Good as new? Yes.
xml.info: Planet Express: Farnsworth's Lab. The crew are assembled in the room.
xml.speak: Leela, Zoidberg, the rest of you, this is Flexo.
xml.info: He points to Flexo who is sat on a worktop.
xml.speak: Sweet llamas of the Bahamas! Except for that stylish beard, he looks just like Bender!
xml.info: Flexo hops off the worktop. His voice is exactly like Bender's.
xml.speak: No duh dreadlock, we're both bending units.
Hey brobot, what's you serial number?
No way! Mine's 2716057!
xml.info: They both laugh. Fry joins in then stops.
xml.speak: I don't get it.
We're both expressable as the sum of two cubes.
xml.info: Flexo cheers and they high five.
xml.speak: So uh, Flexo. Sorry about crushing your body like that. You OK now?
Well I don't feel as bad as you look! Nah I'm just messing with you kid. You're alright. That's some face you got though, I think they got a cream for that. Nah, you're great.
Well just let me know if there's anything I can do to make it up to you.
Actually your little stunt did a number on my back. You mind rubbin' it for me?
Uh...sure.
xml.info: He starts rubbing Flexo's shoulders.
xml.speak: Aw yeah, that's it. A little lower.
xml.info: Lower.
xml.speak: How's that?
Lower. Yeah that's it. A little lower though.
Uh I can't get any lower than this.
I'll say, you're rubbing my ass!
xml.info: He and Bender burst out laughing and high five again.
Outside Electric Ladyland Laptop Dances. A robot advertises what is inside.
xml.speak: Hey, check it out here, six beautiful devices. They know what you like and they'll do it to within a tolerance of one micron!
xml.info: Electric Ladyland Laptop Dances. In the smokey strip club a Fembot does a fan dance with real fans.
xml.speak: Yeah spin those fans baby!
xml.info: Another robot dog whistles.
xml.speak: Alright mama!
Gyrate baby!
xml.info: Flexo and Bender smoke cigars. Fry coughs.
xml.speak: I don't like this place. It's 120 degrees and there's very little oxygen.
Shut up and hoot. Hubba-hubba, she is built! In Mexico I believe.
And that ain't silicon. It's tungsten - and plenty of it!
(unsure) Uh, yeah. Look at that exhaust fan.
Eww!
Pervert.
Yoo-hoo!
xml.info: He waves a dollar and puts it into the stripperbot.
xml.speak: Thanks moderate spender. Please select erotic transaction.
Yeah, how 'bout a lapdance for my pal here?
xml.info: The stripperbot moves towards Fry.
xml.speak: Uh, no, that's alright. Ow! Ow!
xml.info: Planet Express: Meeting Room. The next morning Fry sits at the table with a plaster on his head and holding an icebag to it and wearing a neck brace.
xml.speak: I'm telling you there's something about Flexo I don't like.
xml.info: Enter Flexo and Bender.
xml.speak: Hey Fry, think fast. Get it? It's chlorine!
xml.info: He and Bender laugh and leave. Zoidberg laughs.
xml.speak: It's funny because it's poisonous!
Yeah keep laughing brineshrimp but he's bad news. I regret ever running him over.
Take a rage dump man. He's no worse than Bender.
He's much worse. He drinks, he smokes and he posts naked pictures of me on the internet.
That's Bender alright.
I'm talking about Flexo.
Oh I get it, this is cute. You're jealous of Bender's new friend!
No I'm not. Mark my words. Flexo's evil. He's the evil Bender.
Rage dump!
xml.info: Farnsworth appears on the big screen.
Everyone looks around in confusion.
Planet Express: Farnsworth's Bedroom. Farnsworth sits on his four-poster bed while the crew and Flexo are gathered around.
xml.speak: Everyone get in bed with me. I have something to show you. Feast your eyes on this!
xml.info: Everyone gasps.
xml.speak: It's beautiful.
And huge.
Can I touch it?
xml.info: Behind the curtains Farnsworth holds a big glowing atom.
xml.speak: So what is it already?
It's a single atom of jumbonium. And element so rare, the nucleus alone is worth more than $50,000.
How much more?
100,000. That's why I hid it here. Under my mattress.
Uh Professor, can we discuss this somewhere else?
Why certainly.
xml.info: Planet Express: Farnsworth's Bathroom. Farnsworth sits in the bath still holding the atom a toy scale model of the Planet Express ship floats in the bath with him.
xml.speak: The atom sits atop this dime stored tiara which will be awarded to the winner of this years Miss Universe pageant on the planet Tova 9. Your job is to deliver it, safe and sound.
Wow, when I was a little girl on Mars I dreamed of being Miss Universe.
That's kinda pathetic.
Aw come on Leela. Deep down all girls wanna be Miss Universe.
Not me.
Really? Maybe it's just cute girls.
Due to the atom's tremendous value, Planet Express would go bankrupt if it was stolen. Therefore we'll need to hire on additional security for the mission.
xml.info: Flexo raises his hand.
xml.speak: Oh oh Mr Professor, right here!
Uh, maybe we should stick with people we know and trust. I mean, Flexo's great but -
Flexo's great you say? Well that's good enough for me. Welcome aboard lad.
xml.info: Flexo cackles.
The ship speeds away from Earth en route to Tova 9.
Cut to: Ship's Cargo Bay. Leela puts the atom in a transparent safe and locks it. She turns around, holding a laser.
xml.speak: Space banditos have been operating in this quadrant so you'll each take 8-hour shifts guarding the safe. First Bender, then Flexo, then Fry.
Wait, I don't like the sound of that. Let's just go alphabetically.
OK. First Bender, then Flexo, then Fry.
Wait, let's go by rank.
OK. First Bender, then Flexo, then Fry.
Flexo outranks me?
That's "Flexo outranks me, sir"!
xml.info: He pokes Fry. Then some more.
Time Lapse. Bender's shift has started. He stands with his laser poises, rotating his head around. The cargo bay door opens. Enter Fry. Bender points the laser at him.
xml.speak: Halt. Who goes there?
Don't point that at me.
Fry who?
Look, I know Flexo's your friend but I don't trust him alone with the atom.
My God Fry just 'cause the guy's got a beard you label him as evil? Well I got a label for you pal. An ugly little word called "prejudice."
I'm not prejudiced.
Ah save it for the cross burning Adolf!
xml.info: Time Lapse. Fry is gone and Bender sits with his feet on the safe reading Pentiumhouse magazine. Enter Flexo.
xml.speak: Keeping an eye on the safe?
xml.info: Bender puts down the magazine. He only has one eye.
xml.speak: You know it!
xml.info: He points at his other eye sitting on a crate the other side of the cargo bay, watching the safe.
xml.speak: Well, looks like it's my shift. You lie down and go offline for a while.
xml.info: Bender yawns.
xml.speak: Alright.
xml.info: He picks up his eye and walks out the room whistling. The door closes behind him and Flexo laughs as he looks at the atom. Fry jumps out from behind a crate.
xml.speak: Caught you! I saw you looking at the atom!
So? I look at lots of atoms. Shouldn't you be resting up for your shift?
Oh-ho you'd like it if I went to sleep wouldn't you?
Whatever it takes to shut your yapper. Nah, I'm just kidding you, you're a joker.
Yeah well here's a funny joke. I'm gonna sit right here till it's my shift.
Suit yourself skinbag.
That I will.
Good.
Good.
Good.
Good.
Good.
Good. Good.
xml.info: Time Lapse. Flexo sits with the laser, bored, while Fry paces up and down. Fry's watch beeps.
xml.speak: Well, that's eight hours.
xml.info: He snatches the laser from Flexo.
xml.speak: Yeah eight hours of solid boredom. Nah, I'm kidding, you're a wonderful man.
xml.info: He leaves and Fry sits down.
xml.speak: Finally, the atom is safe.
xml.info: He falls asleep immediately.
The ship flies towards Tova 9.
Outside Miss Universe Pageant. The ship lands on a landing pad near a sign informing people that "Contestants May Not Exceed More Than 50% Implant."
Cut to: Ship's Cargo Bay. The ship shakes as it lands and Fry wakes up. He screams. The safe is broken and the atom is gone. Leela runs in.
xml.speak: What is it? My God! Did you hear maracas?
No.
Then it wasn't space banditos. Bender, lock down the ship, don't let Flexo escape.
xml.info: Behind her Bender is wearing a blue scarf around his neck.
xml.speak: Aye aye captain. It appears that Flexo has outwitted us all. Especially me...Bender.
xml.info: Time Lapse. Leela and Fry look at the broken safe.
xml.speak: How could Flexo have stolen the atom?
He must have used a sleep ray on me. Sleep rays exist in the future right?
No.
Then I must've fallen asleep.
Well you were sure right about Flexo being evil.
xml.info: Bender peers around the doorway, the bottom of his face and his body obscured by the wall.
xml.speak: I locked down the ship but he may have already gotten away.
OK, thanks Bender. Let's fan out and look for him.
Roger that, I got a map of the ship right here.
xml.info: He walks into full view carrying a big map that hides his body and lower face. Leela walks over to him and whispers to him.
xml.speak: (whispering) Keep an eye on Fry. We can't rule out the possibility that he did it.
xml.info: Ship's Medical Lab. Leela sneaks in with her laser at the ready. She flicks on the lights and positions herself by a cupboard marked "Emergency Supplies."
xml.speak: Aha!
xml.info: She opens the cupboard but all that is in there is a clown suit.
Leela's Quarters. Fry snoops around by a chest of drawers.
xml.speak: Aha! Uh searching...hmm.
xml.info: Enter Leela.
xml.speak: Fry? Why are you looking for Flexo in my underpants drawer?
I didn't find him here 10 minutes ago so I thought it was time to check again.
xml.info: Leela slaps his hand. Bender walks in with the map covering him again.
xml.speak: Well, he wasn't in the uh, kitchen room.
(suspicious) Say Bender, can I hold that map for a second?
Any leave me high and dry in case of a scavenger hunt? I think not.
xml.info: Fry starts pulling at the map but Bender holds onto it, with it still covering his face.
xml.speak: Give it up!
xml.info: They struggle for a bit and Fry eventually pulls it away, revealing Bender to be wearing his green turtleneck that covers his chin.
xml.speak: Alright, take it. Sheesh.
xml.info: He leaves. Fry eyes him suspiciously.
Ship's Cargo Bay. Leela and Fry inspect the safe again.
xml.speak: Well, looks like Flexo got away clean.
xml.info: Bender is stood behind Fry wearing another scarf.
xml.speak: It's a darn shame.
He must have jumped ship with the atom the second we landed.
Or maybe, he never left at all! Wait a minute. You're Bender.
Of course, who said I wasn't?
But why were you wearing that scarf, that turtleneck and this fruity number?
It's a little thing called "style." Look it up sometime.
xml.info: He puts the scarf back on.
Outside Miss Universe Pageant. A screen advertises the Miss Universe pageant tonight and the Miss Parallel Universe pageant tomorrow. Flexo runs into the building laughing evily.
Miss Universe Pageant. Inside, the finalists are lined up, all of them grotesque monsters. Bob Barker's head in a jar hosts.
xml.speak: Our ninth finalist, Miss Methane Planet; Halatina Smogmeyer. And our tenth and final finalist, Miss Earth's Moon, the Crushinator.
xml.info: The Crushinator rolls in and crushes some shoes.
xml.speak: (mechanical voice) Thank you Bob Barker, I'm as happy as a girl can be. End statement.
Which one of these lovely womanoids will take home the lovely tiara?
xml.info: From the side of the stage Leela peers around the curtains and gestures to Barker.
xml.speak: (whispering) Downplay the tiara.
Uh, we'll find out after these subliminal messages.
xml.info: Bob Barker's Dressing Room. The Planet Express crew are with him.
xml.speak: So you lost the atom huh? You're garbage, human garbage! Do you braindead space jockeys have any idea how much that thing is worth?
xml.info: Barker looks at Leela.
xml.speak: You're closest without going over.
Well, we'll be leaving now. If you'll just sign this form saying you received the atom.
I'm not signing squat. You find me that damn tiara before the pageant ends.
But Mr Barker -
Enough out of you. I may be against the fur industry, but that won't stop me from skinning you alive! As long as no one wears the skin.
xml.info: A woman wheels him out.
xml.speak: Well gentlemen, it appears we're boned.
xml.info: Flexo wanders past the open door.
xml.speak: Flexo!
Get him!
xml.info: Cut to: Miss Universe Pageant. Miss Unnamed Planet #2859-B plays the William Tell tune on a bugle. She stops and takes her hands away revealing the bugle to be her nose. The judges give their scores. Florp from planet Trisol gives her an 8, Calculon gives her a nine and Zapp Brannigan holds up a "Room 715" sign and shakes the keys to the room sexfully.
xml.speak: Next up in what is generously called the "Talent Competition," performing a traditional gangster rap, Miss - what the?
xml.info: Flexo runs onto the stage followed by Bender, Fry and Leela. The women scream and Bender dives on Flexo.
xml.speak: Got you!
xml.info: They get up and try punching each other, each moving exactly the same way and getting nowhere.
xml.speak: (chanting) Fight! Fight! Fight! Fight! Fight!
xml.info: Leela points a laser at the two robots. They have their hands at each others throats, covering any suspicious goatee that might help tell them apart.
xml.speak: Shoot him, he's choking me!
No shoot him, he's choking me!
xml.info: They struggle and beads of sweat trickle down Leela's face.
xml.speak: I don't know which one to shoot.
Flexo! Shoot Flexo!
xml.info: Bender and Flexo fence each other using their antennas and they break through a wall.
Cut to: Miss Universe Dressing Room. The Miss Universe contestants run away screaming, covering themselves with towels. An Amazonian seperates them.
xml.speak: Women only room!
xml.info: She lifts them up.

Cut to: Miss Universe Pageant. The jellyfish creature Zoidberg hooked up with in A Flight To Remember is in the middle of her rap. Bender and Flexo fly out through the hole in the wall and knock her over. They cover each others chins again.
xml.speak: Alright, enough of this. There's the atom!
Aw jeez.
Bender? You stole the atom?
Yeah but I can explain, it's very valuable.
I saw him snatch it while Fry was asleep. That's why I ran to tell Bob Barker.
Whoa whoa, you mean Bender is the evil Bender? I am shocked, shocked! Well not that shocked.
I'm sorry we suspected you Flexo. It's just, what with the beard and all.
Don't even bother. You people sicken me. I put my life on the line to guard that atom and this is how you repay me? Well you can go rot for all I care. Nah, I'm just kidding, you guys are alright.
xml.info: He walks off laughing.
xml.speak: I'm so confused. The Bender I liked turn out to be evil and the Bender I hated was good. How can I live my life when I can't tell good from evil?
Eh, they're both fine choices, whatever floats your boat.
xml.info: He takes out a cigar and smokes it.
Miss Universe Pageant Backstage. Bob Barker reads a book the woman is holding. URL and Smitty drag Flexo in behind him.
xml.speak: Is this the guy?
Huh? Oh yeah, that looks like him. Whatever.
Wait, but I -
Take him away.
xml.info: Miss Universe Pageant. The contestants are all lined up ready for the winner to be announced.
xml.speak: Alright, let's put an end to this pathetic hoedown. Brannigan read the thing.
And the winner is...
xml.info: He starts to open the envelope. Leela, Fry and Bender watch from the side of the stage.
xml.speak: It figures. Who else but Zapp Brannigan would be judging the most chauvinistic, degrading, dehumanising -
xml.info: Zapp turns around.
xml.speak: Huh? Leela?
xml.info: Everyone applauds and a spotlight moves to Leela.
xml.speak: Wait, you're making a - Ooo! Look at that. I feel like a princess.
xml.info: She starts to cry and walks on the stage and waves to the applauding audience.
xml.speak: Wait. What are you people, idiots? I'm still going mano a mano with this envelope. Miss Vega 4. (singing) There it is, Miss Universe. There it is, looking weird.
xml.info: The tiara sinks into Miss Vega 4. Fry, Leela and Bender watch. Leela sighs.
xml.speak: I almost had that tiara.
Me too.
Well, you guys might both be losers but I just made out with that radiator woman from the radiator planet.
Fry, that's a radiator.
Oh. Is there a burn ward within 10 feet of here?
xml.info: THE END
